data.text: @medlabmaria Me too. Honestly, I'm more anxious about getting her to stay home for the rest of her quarantine period than I am about the test. It was a low risk exposure.
@ineptninja90 I'm so sorry to hear about all that your mom has dealt with in her life. I hope the result turns out negative!

I hope we never, ever forget the character we have seen revealed in the people who denied this virus. I don't want this country to be more divided than it is, but I can't fathom a future where there's no justice for the deaths of our elderly and our black/brown siblings. (4/4)

But I get so incandescently angry when I think about how unnecessary all of this is. It didn't have to be this way. It ISN'T this way in Oregon. The government of Idaho made the decision to use COVID to froth up their base and people are dead as a result. (3/4)

first from a freight train, then breast cancer, and then a fender bender that broke one of her spinal vertebra. She's amazingly healthy, considering, and even if she got COVID she'd probably be fine. (2/4)
